Title: Probing into the Fairness of Large Language Models: A Case Study of ChatGPT
Abstract: understanding and addressing unfairness in llms are crucial for responsible ai deployment. however there is a limited number of quantitative analyses and in depth studies regarding fairness evaluations in llms especially when applying llms to high stakes fields. this work aims to fill this gap by providing a systematic evaluation of the effectiveness and fairness of llms using chatgpt as a study case. we focus on assessing chatgpt‚äôs performance in high takes fields including education criminology finance and healthcare. to conduct a thorough evaluation we consider both group fairness and individual fairness metrics. we also observe the disparities in chatgpt‚äôs outputs under a set of biased or unbiased prompts. this work contributes to a deeper understanding of llms‚äô fairness performance facilitates bias mitigation and fosters the development of responsible ai systems. code and data are open sourced on github 1.
